content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df.ym = Vector{String}(undef, length(df.dt))
    for (i, dt) in enumerate(df.dt)
        yr = string(Base.Dates.year(dt))
        mo = string(Base.Dates.month(dt))
        df.ym[i] = yr * mo
    end
    return df
end

# Example usage:

using DataFrames

df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[]) # Initialize your DataFrame with some data here
add_yearmonth(df)
println(df)

This function will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame `df` by extracting the year and month from each element in the `dt` column and concatenating them together as an integer in the format "yyyymm". Note that this is a basic implementation without any error handling or checking for invalid dates.
